prompt: Whitney Houston: Iconic singer with unparalleled vocal prowess and record-breaking achievements. Please write a short biography of Whitney Houston.
response:
Whitney Houston (July 9, 1963 – February 11, 2012) was an American singer, songwriter, actress, and philanthropist. Born and raised in Newark, New Jersey, Houston began her singing career at a young age, joining her siblings in the family gospel group, the Drinkard Singers.

Houston's talent and exceptional vocal ability led her to sign a recording contract with Arista Records at the age of 19. Her first solo album, "Whitney Houston," released in 1985, was a massive success and produced the hit singles "I Wanna Dance with Somebody (Who Loves Me)" and "Saving All My Love for You." The album sold over 23 million copies worldwide, making her the best-selling female R&B artist of the 1980s.

Throughout the 1980s and 1990s, Houston released a series of successful albums, including "Whitney," "I'm Your Baby Tonight," "The Bodyguard Soundtrack," and "My Love Is Your Love," which showcased her incredible vocal range and versatility across different musical styles. Houston won numerous awards, including 11 Grammy Awards and eight American Music Awards.

In addition to her musical success, Houston also gained recognition for her acting career, appearing in films such as "The Bodyguard," "The Preacher's Wife," and "Sparkle." She received multiple awards for her performances, including the Academy Award for Best Original Song for her contribution to "The Bodyguard" soundtrack.

Aside from her music and acting career, Houston was also a devoted philanthropist. She worked with numerous charities, including the Whitney Houston Foundation for Children, which aimed to improve the lives of children facing adversity.

Tragically, Houston's life was cut short at the age of 48 due to accidental drowning in her Los Angeles hotel room. Her death was mourned by millions worldwide, and she remains an influential and beloved figure in the world of music and entertainment. Despite her untimely passing, Houston's legacy continues to inspire and influence artists and fans around the globe.

Whitney Houston (July 9, 1963 – February 11, 2012) was an American singer, songwriter, and actress whose powerful and emotive voice, coupled with her ability to perform a range of musical styles, earned her the title of the "Queen of Soul." Born in Newark, New Jersey, she was raised in the Houston area of Texas. Houston rose to fame as a recording artist, television personality, and fashion model.

Houston's career began as a child, singing on local radio and television. She later auditioned for the girl group The Sweet Inspirations and eventually became the lead singer. Houston's breakout performance came in 1984 with the release of her self-titled debut album, which featured the hit single "You Give Good Love." This success launched her into the international music scene and set the stage for a series of hit albums, including "Whitney," "I'm Your Baby Tonight," and "The Bodyguard: Original Soundtrack Album."

Throughout her career, Houston received multiple Grammy, Emmy, and Billboard Music Awards, becoming one of the best-selling recording artists of all time. Her signature song "I Will Always Love You," originally written and recorded by Dolly Parton, remains an enduring classic and has become synonymous with Houston's legacy.

Houston's success also extended into acting, with her most notable role in the 1992 film "The Bodyguard," for which she won an Academy Award for Best Original Song for "I Will Always Love You." She reprised the role in the film's sequel, "The Bodyguard: Backstage," in 2005.

Despite her immense success, Houston struggled with personal and professional challenges throughout her life. She battled substance abuse, and in 2010, she was arrested on charges of driving under the influence. Her untimely death in 2012, resulting from accidental drowning in a bathtub, sent shockwaves throughout the music world and brought her career achievements into sharp focus. Whitney Houston remains a lasting icon of the entertainment industry, and her music continues to inspire and influence artists worldwide.
